item.title: 中国铁矿石需求下降，Fortescue 利润骤降 53
item.description: 由于中国对炼钢材料的需求减弱，铁矿石价格下跌，导致 Fortescue Ltd. 上半年利润同比骤降 53%。【原文：Fortescue Ltd.’s first-half profit plunged by 53% from the year before, hit by a decline in iron ore prices as Chinese demand for the steelmaking material waned.】

item.title: 对关税持谨慎态度的债券交易商回撤，美国利率波动性下跌
item.description: 在全球贸易战不断扩大的不确定性下，国债交易员们纷纷转而观望，导致衡量波动性的一个指标降至三年来的最低水平，并使收益率在区间内波动。【原文：Treasury traders are heading to the sidelines amid uncertainty over an expanding global trade war, sending one measure of volatility to its lowest level in three years and leaving yields rangebound.】

item.title: 贝森特将缺席在南非举行的二十国集团财长会议
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士说，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特不会前往参加下周在南非举行的 20 国集团财长会议，因为他将在上任后的头几周内专注于国内议程。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent won’t travel to the Group of 20 finance ministers meeting in South Africa next week as he focuses on the domestic agenda in his first weeks in office, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 律师下台后，特许经营集团推进重组工作
item.description: 特许经营集团公司（Franchise Group Inc. 尽管遭到次级贷款人的反对，而且指导这家陷入困境的品牌管理公司度过破产难关的律师事务所最近也被解聘，但该公司仍获得法院许可，继续推进可能的重组。【原文：Franchise Group Inc. won court permission to press ahead with a potential restructuring despite pushback from junior lenders and the recent removal of the law firm that had guided the troubled brand manager through bankruptcy.】

item.title: GTCR 为第二支战略增长基金筹资 36 亿美元
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社查阅的一份声明，私募股权公司 GTCR 为第二支战略增长基金募集了 36 亿美元，超过了 27.5 亿美元的目标，增强了其对小型收购的火力。【原文：Private equity firm GTCR raised $3.6 billion for a second strategic growth fund, surpassing its $2.75 billion target and boosting its firepower for smaller buyouts, according to a statement reviewed by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 特朗普削减联邦劳动力的早期影响迹象如下
item.description: 周四的美国失业救济申请报告可能是特朗普政府对联邦劳动力进行大扫荡所产生影响的第一份报告。这只是一个开始。【原文：Thursday’s report on applications for US unemployment benefits may be the first place to see the effects of the Trump administration’s sweep of the federal workforce. That’ll just be the start.】

item.title: 英国和法国计划向特朗普呼吁美国在乌克兰提供空中支援
item.description: 英国和法国正在制定由欧洲领导的乌克兰 "再保证部队 "计划，以确保在停火与和平协议谈判达成后俄罗斯不会再次袭击乌克兰。【原文：The UK and France are drawing up plans for a European-led “reassurance force” for Ukraine, to ensure Russia doesn’t attack the country again if a ceasefire and peace deal are negotiated.】

item.title: 博斯蒂克支持暂停美联储等待特朗普政策细节
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）表示，官员们在评估唐纳德-特朗普总统的政策可能会对经济产生何种影响时应保持耐心，并指出有些方法可能会加剧通胀，而另一些方法则可能会引发投资。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said officials should be patient when evaluating how President Donald Trump’s policies may affect the economy, noting some approaches could add to inflation while others could spark investment.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要披露有关暂停资产负债表缩减的讨论，国债上涨
item.description: 美联储上个月的会议纪要显示，决策者讨论了在政府债务上限问题解决之前暂停或放缓资产负债表扩张的问题，随后美国国债上涨。【原文：US Treasuries rose after the minutes from last month’s Federal Reserve meeting revealed policymakers discussed pausing or slowing the balance-sheet runoff until the government’s debt-ceiling drama is resolved.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行聘用银行家加强消费者和零售交易团队
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行资本市场（RBC Capital Markets）聘用了两名资深消费和零售银行家，以加强其负责该行业并购的团队。【原文：RBC Capital Markets has hired two senior consumer and retail bankers as it boosts its team covering mergers and acquisitions in the sector.】

item.title: Forever 21 在第二次破产中计划关闭数百家门店
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Forever 21 Inc. 的美国运营商正准备从这家快速时尚零售商不断缩小的门店群中再关闭至少 200 家门店，作为破产程序的一部分，预计最快将于下月启动。【原文：The US-based operator of Forever 21 Inc. is preparing to close at least 200 more locations from the fast-fashion retailer’s shrinking store base as part of a bankruptcy process that’s expected to kick off as soon as next month, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 卡尼誓言控制政府开支，为加拿大公共服务设定上限
item.description: 马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）承诺，如果他出任总理，将为加拿大公共服务部门的规模设定上限，并对项目支出进行审查，但没有详细说明他将从总体上削减多少政府支出。【原文：Mark Carney promised to cap the size of the Canadian public service and undertake a program spending review if he becomes prime minister, but did not provide details of how much he would reduce government outlays overall.】

item.title: 道明表示，尽管关税分散了人们的注意力，但仍应继续押注美元
item.description: 道明证券（TD Securities）敦促交易员继续做多美元，因为尽管唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的关税威胁引发了波动，但基本面驱动因素仍使美元有望上涨。【原文：TD Securities is urging traders to stay long the US dollar as fundamental drivers keep the currency poised for gains despite the volatility spurred by President Donald Trump’s tariff threats.】

item.title: 路透社称巴里克签署协议结束马里金矿争端
item.description: 据路透社报道，巴里克黄金公司（Barrick Gold Corp.该公司股价大涨。【原文：Barrick Gold Corp. signed an agreement with Mali’s government to end a dispute over its mining assets in the country, according to a report from Reuters. The company’s shares jumped.】

item.title: 埃克森公司计划提高圭亚那天然气产量，并看好出口潜力
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）国家经理阿利斯泰尔-劳特利奇（Alistair Routledge）周三表示，埃克森美孚公司计划增加以石油为重点的圭亚那的天然气产量，并正在考虑向全球市场出口这种燃料的方案。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. outlined plans to increase natural gas production from oil-focused Guyana and is considering options to export the fuel to global markets, country manager Alistair Routledge said Wednesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊提供每月 20 美元的地区体育网络附加服务
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的 Prime Video 与频道所有者 Main Street Sports Group 达成协议，开始提供 16 个地区性体育网络，作为其常规流媒体服务的附加服务，每月收费 20 美元。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s Prime Video has begun offering 16 regional sports networks as a $20-a-month addition to its regular streaming service in a deal with channel-owner Main Street Sports Group.】

item.title: 欧盟准备与美国讨论降低汽车关税，贸易负责人称
item.description: 欧盟最高贸易官员周三在华盛顿表示，欧盟准备讨论削减汽车和其他商品的关税，以避免与美国爆发贸易战。【原文：The European Union is ready to discuss cutting tariffs on autos and other goods as it seeks to head off a trade war with the US, the bloc’s top trade official said Wednesday in Washington.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要显示官员将按兵不动直至通胀改善
item.description: 美联储官员在 1 月份表示，他们准备在通胀顽固和经济政策不确定的情况下保持利率稳定。【原文：Federal Reserve officials in January expressed their readiness to hold interest rates steady amid stubborn inflation and economic policy uncertainty.】

item.title: 可可短缺引发贸易商与科特迪瓦托运人之间的纠纷
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，可可短缺正在引发象牙海岸最大生产国的当地出口商与全球最大的两家贸易商之间的裂痕。【原文：A cocoa shortfall is spurring a rift between local exporters in top producer Ivory Coast and two of the world’s biggest traders, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 投资者是否过于看空？我们即将揭晓
item.description: 一项备受关注的调查显示，个人投资者的看跌情绪是 2023 年底以来最严重的。也许是对通胀、裁员和关税的担忧一并涌上心头。【原文：According to a highly-regarded survey, individual investors are the most bearish they’ve been since late 2023. Perhaps worries about inflation, job cuts, and tariffs are all sinking in at once.】

item.title: 哈维尔-米莱的加密货币丑闻导致 86% 的交易者蒙受损失
item.description: 据研究公司南森（Nansen）称，上周五，在阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）认可的一种memecoin上建仓的加密货币交易者中，估计有86%最终亏损。【原文：An estimated 86% of crypto traders that took positions in a memecoin endorsed by Argentine President Javier Milei on Friday ended up losing money, according to research firm Nansen.】

item.title: 开发商斥资 2200 万美元购入亚利桑那州地块，押注数据中心建设
item.description: 亚利桑那州土地咨询公司（Arizona Land Consulting）在该州抢购了 160 英亩土地，以扩大对数据中心繁荣的投资。【原文：Arizona Land Consulting snapped up 160 acres in the state as it expands its bet on the data-center boom.】

item.title: Saylor 战略为 20 亿美元可转换债券提供优惠条件
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的战略公司正在为其拟发行的 20 亿美元可转换债券向投资者提供更优惠的条件。【原文：Michael Saylor’s Strategy is offering investors sweeter terms for its proposed $2 billion issue of convertible debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Ecopetrol 加大对哥伦比亚石油资源丰富的东部平原的投资力度
item.description: 国家控制的石油钻探公司 Ecopetrol SA 认为，在哥伦比亚的原油生产中心地带进行开发和勘探具有 "巨大潜力"，同时还将赌注押在了美国的压裂技术和近海天然气上。【原文：State-controlled oil driller Ecopetrol SA sees “great potential” for development and exploration in Colombia’s crude-producing heartland alongside bets on US fracking and offshore gas.】

item.title: 力拓追随大型矿业同行利润下滑
item.description: 力拓集团（Rio Tinto Group）成为最新一家年度利润下滑的矿业巨头，原因是该行业正努力应对其最大客户中国的需求疲软。【原文：Rio Tinto Group became the latest mining major to post a slide in annual profit as the industry grapples with weaker demand from its top customer China.】

item.title: 商务部将下令大规模解雇芯片和人工智能工作人员
item.description: 作为唐纳德-特朗普总统对联邦政府大刀阔斧削减政策的一部分，商务部下属的国家标准与技术研究院（National Institute of Standards and Technology）正准备解雇多达约 500 名试用期员工。【原文：The National Institute of Standards and Technology, a lab housed under the Commerce Department, is preparing to fire as many as roughly 500 probationary staffers as part of President Donald Trump’s sweeping cuts to the federal government.】

item.title: 特朗普将终止批准纽约拥堵定价法案
item.description: 特朗普政府正着手阻止纽约市的交通拥堵收费计划，推翻了去年获得的联邦批准，很可能会就收费举措展开一场法律对决。【原文：The Trump administration is moving to block New York City’s congestion pricing program, reversing a federal approval granted last year and likely setting up a legal showdown over the tolling initiative.】

item.title: 美国正式指定贩毒集团为恐怖组织
item.description: 美国国务院根据唐纳德-特朗普总统在上任第一天签署的行政命令，将在拉丁美洲活动的八个卡特尔组织定为恐怖组织。【原文：The US State Department designated eight cartels operating in Latin America as terrorist organizations, following an executive order President Donald Trump signed during his first day in office.】

item.title: 在特朗普加征关税之前，洛杉矶港口一月份创下历史新高
item.description: 这个美国最繁忙的贸易中心上个月的集装箱运输量超过了以往任何一个一月，因为进口商们赶在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普广泛预期的关税上调之前运入货物。【原文：The busiest trade hub in the US moved more containers last month than in any previous January, as importers rushed to bring in goods before widely anticipated tariff hikes from President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 瑞典官员称欧盟关税对策必须符合世贸组织规定
item.description: 据瑞典贸易部长称，欧盟将确保对美国关税的任何回应都必须符合世界贸易组织的规则，这可能会限制欧盟的报复选择。【原文：The European Union will make sure that any response to US tariffs must be compliant with World Trade Organization rules, according to Sweden’s trade minister, potentially limiting the bloc’s options to retaliate.】
